website_summaries.verdict: The 2019 Roku Ultra (2019) is a very good 4K streaming box that puts convenience at the fore, but lack of Dolby Vision and a high price compared to other Rokus hold it back.
pros: The Roku Ultra 2019 has a few neat conveniences including a voice remote with programmable shortcut buttons
It's slightly faster than earlier Rokus
Ease of use remains best-in-class, and its Ethernet port is a boon for folks with spotty Wi-Fi
cons: The $100 Ultra's extras aren't worth the money over the cheaper Streaming Stick Plus
The Ultra still doesn't offer Dolby Vision HDR

website_summaries.verdict: The latest Roku Ultra is a capable media streamer just like its predecessor, and its biggest selling point remains a headphone jack on the remote.
pros: Advanced remote with headphone jack, finder function, and programmable shortcut buttons
Slightly faster performance than previous model
cons: Voice features lag far behind Amazon Alexa and Google Assistant

customer_reviews.title: Compatibility
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews for this product. No where did it say anything about not being compatible with certain TV'S. Tried to set it up and it doesn't work on my TV. Now told by the company that it isn't compatible.
customer_reviews.author: KIM LACASSE

customer_reviews.title: Remote doesn’t operate consistently.
customer_reviews.text: So far, I haven’t noticed much difference between this 2019 model & the 2018. The remote is problematic- sometimes I hit a button & it performs the action incorrectly. I dislike the location of the mute button - it’s located on the side, right where my fingers touch it accidentally when holding the remote. So far I see no reason to upgrade to the 2019 Ultra.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Youtube TV black screen issues
customer_reviews.text: Have a house full of Roku's, going back to a series three and up to new sticks less than a year old. ALL stream Netflix, prime, apple, Hulu, and Youtube TV just fine without any issues. Ordered three Roku ultra's and all seemed fine with the exception of Youtube TV. Changing channels 2 out of 10 times resulted in black screen with no way out other than hitting home button and launching app again. All three ultra's exhibited same behavior. Two connected by ethernet and one wifi. Since it wasn't an issue with the other Roku's I was left to believe it was something with the new Ultra's and returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Since 1998

customer_reviews.title: The extra charges aren't listed in the product description
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Roku box. After hooking it up as per instructions I called go.roku.com/selectinput as instructed. Was told by someone in India whom I could barely understand that my Roku account had to be upgraded to the newer software and there would be a one time fee of $69.95 for the upgrade. I'm sending my Roku Ultra back and going back to my older model. The rep offered me a discount when I objected which only added insult to injury. I told her I wasn't going pay one more red cent for the box. Therefore it's useless for me so I'm sending it back and going back to my older model.
customer_reviews.author: Jubal

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and add the channels I wanted I was blown away that it automatically programmed itself to my tv on/off and volume control. The remote find feature is a must for any tv remote and it works great. Very fast and we even love the aquarium screensaver Happy customer here
customer_reviews.author: Consumer49

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the significantly higher price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Roku Ultra (the most expensive Roku) because its remote supposedly allowed for volume and TV power control. Turns out that the remote only controls the volume on your TV. If you have an A/V receiver or surround sound because you'd actually like to hear what you're watching, you're out of luck. I also found that the Roku remote didn't properly turn my TV on. So I exchanged it for a much less expensive Roku. Don't waste your money. This model offers very little that's any better than the cheaper versions. Get one of those, and get yourself a working universal remote instead.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kent

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT support Netflix
customer_reviews.text: First I realized that the sound cuts out every 10 minutes for about 2 seconds. I contacted Roku SUPPORT and they where NOT able to help. Next I figured that when you start Netflix, it freezes. Again I tried the Support. The answer was always: Unplug, wait 10 seconds and restart. That actually works but I refuse to do that 10 times a day, or whenever somebody wants to start Netflix. While researching on my own I realized that all these problems are well known since 2016. So why trust a company who was NOT able to fix technical problems that has been reported for 3 years. Do yourself a favor and stay away from Roku.
customer_reviews.author: EmmaReadsAlot

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete product
customer_reviews.text: Ummmmmm, ya still need to buy a separate cord (HDMI). You’d think for the $100 the normally charge, Roku would ditch the earphones I’ll never use, and include the cord that I need to actually hook it up. It makes no sense. I can’t even use it until I buy a second item. I’m glad I got the Black Friday price or else I would have thrown this thing across the room already. Ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: PoopyPants

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Support
customer_reviews.text: Cannot log into Roku account. Tried calling Roku to no avail. I call and they tell me longer than normal hold time. Did not provide how long. After sitting on hold for half hour, they tell me to log in (which remember I cannot do). Then hangs up. I called two more times. I tells me longer than normal hold, then goes to fast busy signal. If I cannot log into my account, then someone may have hacked it. Roku requires a CC and they could not care that they allowed my account to be hacked. Very disappointed with lack of customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce M.

customer_reviews.title: Useless piece of junk... Your smart tv software is better than this
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk... Where do i start? -It won't let you load the device without creating an account -It is mandatory to put a payment method, either a card or paypal, otherwise you won't be able to set it up -It doesn't shutdown, the power button on remote switches off the tv -there is no search function for apps, you have to scroll down and literally locate everything manually -until now nothing is free or discounted, most apps are their normal rate... How is this any different from a normal smart tv???????
customer_reviews.author: Mohamad Khattab

customer_reviews.title: No better than prior models, much more expensive and dead batteries two weeks after receiving it.
customer_reviews.text: I just wasted my money, this is no better than prior versions, the batteries included were dead in two weeks, and then they have ZERO humans in customer service. This company is not managed very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy network connection
customer_reviews.text: Bought Ultra to replace my Express that often loses network connectivity. The Ultra still loses network just as often on the wired ethernet. Roku tech support is absolutely no help as their first inclination is to blame everything else but their product. After they get over that, the only thing they suggest is to restart the Roku, reset the network, or try a different network. The community support pages show that many other people experience these network drops.
customer_reviews.author: NytWolf

customer_reviews.title: Love Roku!
customer_reviews.text: This is not my first Roku, but it is my best Roku! The picture quality is fantastic! I have read other reviews complaining that the Roku keeps streaming after turning the tv off, this will only happen if Roku is not put to the home screen first. Home then off. I have access to all sorts of content, much of it free & on demand!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but intrusive.
customer_reviews.text: Took only a few minutes to set up and it works fine like my former Roku did. But was watching something on Roku channel the other day and there was a Target commercial. All of a sudden a popup came up informing me where my nearest Target store was. So Roku is now using my address for advertising purposes. Not pleased with this intrusive new "feature".
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Love Roku! I trust them enough to preorder new products.
customer_reviews.text: Best Roku I have had so far. I have all the confidence in Roku products. This is the 6th Roku I have purchased. All purchases after the 1st have been upgrades. The Roku I phase out always to to someone who continues to use it. Our household currently has a Roku on every TV. This Roku has 2 buttons you can set up to open the channels you use the most. Great convenience. I will also give a verbal command into the remote to open a channel. I use 3 of the 4 preassigned buttons. I always see new development with Roku. They will always stay at the top of streaming devices for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Greene

customer_reviews.title: Great...except for the remote issues
customer_reviews.text: The Roku itself, is great.. I'm Loving it. But there seems to be quite the history of the remote's having issues. 1st night we used it, watching netflix we tried to turn the program off, or go to the menu or....anything and the remote was dead. Or at least, I had to remove the batteries and re install them. I ASSUME it is a turn off feature for the remote, but its wake up feature not well designed. That is my opinion of the issue, I don't know why it is problematic, considering it is not blue tooth.
customer_reviews.author: T. Light

customer_reviews.title: It's a piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: It freezes up and reboots itself all the time. Nothing works to fix it. EDIT: Finally went back to my old Roku Premiere and that works fine. Past my return window so I can't return this piece of junk. Waited too long. If you have the same problems don't wait. Send it back right away.
customer_reviews.author: JohnM

customer_reviews.title: No cable included
customer_reviews.text: Now I have to run to Best Buy and purchase a HDMI to microHDMI cable for $30.00 (not included). Great.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Sherwood

customer_reviews.title: I hope Amazon won’t deliver to the wrong house on my next order
customer_reviews.text: The Roku work better than I planned so many choices for television! However Amazon delivered it to someone else’s house it took me a couple of hours to find it and get my package back. And Amazons delivered many things to my house.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Wilder

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy needs work. Mine took 40 minutes to set up. I pushed the Netflix button and it went crazy and never worked again only flashed and pulsated the screen. Return started
customer_reviews.author: Ernest A. Mullen

customer_reviews.title: $100 hidden fee; bait-and-switch
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product without reading this review! While activating this item an error message appeared on our TV screen (monitor) asking me to call ROKU. Upon calling, I was informed there was a $100 activation fee! On my TV it clearly stated there was NO activation fee for the unit. Upon telling the ROKU representative this, he replied their policy had changed in 2020 and there was now a $100 charge for activation. This is definitely bait-and-switch. I told him no thank you. This is why this item is being returned. I have an older ROKU and wanted to upgrade to a newer model. I just reinstalled my older unit and returned the new unit Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Titan Webber

customer_reviews.title: Fine, except you can't watch it for very long.
customer_reviews.text: Second one returned for same issue. Overheats and goes haywire regularly. Seems to work fine when I put it on a far for a while to cool it down.
customer_reviews.author: Bennett P Collier

customer_reviews.title: Problems with the one I received.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I've tried and am sending it back also. You can shut off the "menu voice" in the settings which I did, because it is so irritating to listen to, and it worked fine for about 2 weeks....all of a sudden the voice is back and it won't shut off no matter what. Japan.........you should make your own product..better quality!
customer_reviews.author: B.E.

customer_reviews.title: Netflix loses sync and is not usable
customer_reviews.text: I had the 2017 version of this and it worked fine until it died. This version works until I start Netflix. The screen then goes blank. It usually works if I then remove power and start back up. Really annoying. I replaced on unit on the chance it was something with the hardware but second unit exhibits exactly the same symptoms. Wish there were a better alternative out there...
customer_reviews.author: Dick Locke

customer_reviews.title: where is tech support
customer_reviews.text: Decent upgrade but encountered several glitches and bugs and trying to call ROKU is next to impossible, no it's impossible. Online support is not always accurate. Despite having a prior account and upgrading, I had to redo all my usernames and passwords for all the streaming sites, which makes no sense since Roku has it all on their servers. Getting it synched was very difficult and it refused to recognize the remote that came with it!! Took 2 hours of trying as tech support was somewhere in the cloud not connecting with planet Earth
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Image and sound quality is really excellent if connected properly
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use for streaming Disney+. I have it connected directly by wire to the internet router -- Works great. Excellent image and no waiting for buffering etc. Several Disney+ shows have Dolby Atmos sound, and any good 5.1 audio mix sounds excellent if the Roku is connected to a good receiver with multiple speakers. Anyone that connects a streaming device by WiFi or Bluetooth is losing the full power of this (or any other) streaming device.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Smoot

customer_reviews.title: frequent hdcp 2.2 error
customer_reviews.text: This roku has been extremely frustrating. i get frequent hdcp 2.2 error, that sometimes nedd to unplug TV , unplug roku, and restart both in a certain sequence. I changed the HDMI cable to a certified 8k cable, thinking that the HDMI cable was the problem. Still having issues. I get the error sometimes when i am switching channel on the roku. TV is 4k with a hdcp2.2 plug and roku is plugged directly. never had this problem with other boxes ( Amazon cube, sony bluray player). after i was getting frustrated, i was searching online, and it seems that this problem is common once you google it from 2017. No fix . this was bought new from amazon: 4670R.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Love the Roku platform!
customer_reviews.text: Love Roku, every since I switched from the fire stick. Very fast download speeds of apps and movies/tv shows on those apps. Tons of options to find movies and TV shows free or subscription plus Roku own app had a ton of free old and new movies/tv shows as well. Love the headphone feature too when I don't want to wake up the hubby at night when watching tv. The JBL headphones they provide are really good about blocking out sound as well.
customer_reviews.author: Just a Momo

customer_reviews.title: Roku vs fire stick
customer_reviews.text: Youtube and YouTube tv work good. Netflix, hulu, amazon prime video, disney plus, all of the streaming apps work good. Mine is connected to a ethernet cable. But occasionally I have to go the system to do a restart. Not sure why. But I do...and there is no web browser like silk from fire stick or Firefox. If Roku would get a web browser it would be the bomb. If Amazon fire stick would do youtube and YouTube tv that would be the bomb. These are some simple issues that I feel both streaming devices could work out for the customer.
customer_reviews.author: Coffee

customer_reviews.title: Great system, but remote is a battery hog (sadly, CANNOT recommend!)
customer_reviews.text: Overall, we've loved our Roku and even loved the plug-in headphones that go right into the remote. HOWEVER, the remote eats through batteries like someone stranded on a deserted island with a tapeworm eating through a buffet! We've already 2 sets of premium AA batteries in less than a month! This needs to be rechargeable or something. We don't always use the headphones, but sometimes we do (about 50%-60% of the time of use). It's a great idea, but until they make this system more energy efficient, I cannot recommend this particular set up.
customer_reviews.author: sealyons

customer_reviews.title: It’s fast.
customer_reviews.text: This new model is much faster. This our third Roku device which we are using all 3. The remote will turn tv on and off but because we have a sound bar it won’t pair. Do get the MicroSD to store everything once you get it set up. It keeps track of where you are at with different series also should you lose power.
customer_reviews.author: ABjones

customer_reviews.title: another downvote due to HDCP errors
customer_reviews.text: another ultra user with un-resolvable HDCP errors. and I'm only watching 1080p content to a 1080p display. (through a 4k compatible receiver). zero similar problems watching the same content on a 2019 streaming stick+ (but that doesnt have an ethernet port). so right now, if you want an ethernet port: roku doesn't offer any functional offerings (they removed it from the current premier+) since the ultra is clearly flawed.
customer_reviews.author: david s raistrickTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: ⭐POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE. STILL DEAD REMOTE.
customer_reviews.text: 2020 0111: Currently⭐: After 7+ yrs of satisfied use of Roku 2XS, upgraded to Roku Ultra (& Cox). Installation (& remote pairing) simple and very quickly accomplished. After about one week's use (significant improvement over old Roku 2XS), remote stopped working. No longer pairs or function in any way! Roku customer service was NOT helpful with many repeated texts to me re-asking about my problem. Simply now: (1) remote is NON-FUNCTIONAL and (2) customer service is NOT. PS: Roku ap works great on Android phone. Good luck folks! //F3
customer_reviews.author: F. S.

customer_reviews.title: Much better than Roku Streaming Stick+
customer_reviews.text: From the information Roku provides, if's difficult to tell if the Ultra has better performance than the Streaming Stick+ or if the benefits are limited to a bunch of added frills such as an Ethernet connection and a headset. I can now report that there really is a performance improvement to be had by going with the Ultra. It has better WiFi reception but, more importantly, it responds to commands much faster. So switching channels or loading shows is noticeably quicker. Furthermore, I think there might also be a slightly improved picture quality. The improved WiFi is very apparent if your Roku is located at any significant distance from your WiFi router.
customer_reviews.author: docj

customer_reviews.title: The best by far!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned both Apple TV and Fire TV and hated them both, mostly for the same reasons: they were slooow, hard to navigate, had extremely limited customization, and constantly pushed paid content to the top of your suggestion lists. The Roku Ultra easily solved all those problems. It's super-fast with great voice recognition, lets you customize what you want to see, and offers tons of free content. The Ultra can also control your TV volume, power, and mute functions. I love that you can plug in a pair of earbuds to the remote to watch a show without disturbing anyone. This is a very well thought-out device!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Abell

customer_reviews.title: What a bummer
customer_reviews.text: I get static noise when I use headphones through the remote control. Absulotley annoying. What a waste of money. Zero star is way overrated ranking

customer_reviews.title: Gets kinda hot, but only drains 4 watts, so .. eh
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine. Haven't tested the programmable buttons yet, and the four "convenience" (paid promotion) buttons are still Roku's stupidest "feature." The price should be lower if I have to look at an advertisement every time I see the remote. Be careful removing those. Remote control buttons are almost always part of the same singular rubber sheet, so don't try to pull them out. Also the device gets pretty hot itself, so don't put anything on it. Well, unless you want to reheat your coffee XD. What's weird is it only uses up 4 watts, so how it's able to generate all that energy while consuming so little is beyond me.
customer_reviews.author: John Gerity

customer_reviews.title: for a hundred backs adding a male to male hdmi cable should be included instead of ear
customer_reviews.text: headphones fit over your head covering your ears ear phones are what you get at the dollar store
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product and Picture, get one.
customer_reviews.text: I've only been using a week and I love it. This replaces the Stick I initially purchased while waiting for this new model to be released. I have it hard wired instead of using wireless like I used the Stick and have to say that both have performed similarly with a great broadcast and picture. This has finally allowed me to cut the cord. Purchased Hulu Live and NetflixPremium to use with the Roku and it's still less than half of my monthly Dish bill that I am replacing while giving me more options and flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Swick

customer_reviews.title: The feature I was most excited for is the worst.
customer_reviews.text: I have a small home where the sounds carry loudly. I also have young children. I wanted to be able to plug the headphones into the remote and be able to watch something that’s not animated or rated only PG at best, once the littles go to bed. The crackling and static noises through the headphones are maddening. It’s not every time, but it’s frequent. At first, I thought it was old batteries, but it happened this evening, when the batteries were just swapped out this afternoon! So frustrating!!! Also, get used to slow streaming. Every other device is speeding through, but this one.
customer_reviews.author: K. Draper

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Streaming Device
customer_reviews.text: My family and I love this! It didn't cost much as we bought it used. It came in the original box, wrapped in plastic and everything. I don't think it was ever really used probably just opened. I can get all my apps up there and I love the free Roku Channels! I love that it has a USB port so that I can watch things I put on my hard drive. Overall this is an amazing device!
customer_reviews.author: Zeairah

customer_reviews.title: Great picture but setup could be easier.
customer_reviews.text: High quality picture. My 2 beefs are: 1-no HDMI cable included. 2-ROKU doesn’t like anything other than letters & numbers in your network password. It took me over a week to figure this out. If you have a problem with ROKU not connecting on setup, either change your network password to numbers and letters only or setup a “guest” password with numbers and letters only. It is not a simple process to setup but I managed to fumble my way through it enough that I bough one for my 91 year old mother and helped her to setup over the phone. Just beware it is a little time consuming to setup. Follow the instructions completely and you’ll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ron P.

customer_reviews.title: Fast streaming with great buffering time
customer_reviews.text: I have bought about ten of these for myself and friends. Fast streaming and easily setup through Roku account. The reason I gave only 3 stars for Voice and Alexa is I do not use these features but they may come in handy for other users. The buffering is great for these and wireless setup is a breeze to get connected. I have people streaming off my Plex movie server located in Florida back to Denver, Virginia, and Seattle without any buffering issues. The one new thing they have with the remote is a mute function for those annoying commercials (Everyone knows what I'm talking about) which is a great added feature.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Big improvement
customer_reviews.text: I like this new Roku Ultra as compared to my old Roku XS2 it has much more responsive software and features, very easy to setup and if you have problems very easy to troubleshoot using built in menu unlike older model or stick models, the only thing I hate about this Roku series is that Roku could have put the mute/volume buttons on the face of the remote instead of the side because every time you handle the remote you touch the volume or mute button but a plus is that you can hook up a direct cable to this unit unlike a stick where your dependent upon signal strength
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Nice menus and controls, good remote.
customer_reviews.text: It has Prime and HULU which we use. The setup was nice. It's cheaper than Apple TV, which I have seen and is similar. The remote has voice control capability and an earphone jack for quiet listening. Player controls are better than the ones on my Smart TV.
customer_reviews.author: thatsrich

customer_reviews.title: HDM1 port not included
customer_reviews.text: Was disappointed that it didn't include a HDM1 port. After spending $100+dollars I had to go buy one. Wasn't a happy person, I'm a 77 yrs old living on a very limited income. I have done a lot of business with Amazon & this is the 1st time I was disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Martin

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: Top of the line for a separate streaming device. But you have to create a ROKU account, and they try to have you add a credit card to the account for possible purchases. But there was a not so simple way around that, either when registering with the device on a TV or on the web-site. It used to be simpler to create a ROKU account. One is needed for each box that you use in your home. And I got stuck with all of these unwanted channels when I created an additional Roku account, that were added, which I had to delete one at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: It's a RIP OFF......
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this item, they say the set up is free but they wouldn't let me connect till I paid a registration fee of 140 dollars plus you are giving your card number to a stranger in India,....not me! I returned it to hell with roku......
customer_reviews.author: Scorpinox

customer_reviews.title: So Far Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I pre-ordered this to replace my aging Amazon FireTV box. However we've been using the Roku Stick+ for 3yrs so we knew what we were getting into. I think Roku makes an excellent device. The new Ultra is fantastic. We use PLEX media server -> PLEX app on Roku -> 4K HDR TV to play 4K movies. Works 100% for us. YouTube TV, SlingTV, ESPN+, Shudder, Pluto, all work excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Doc1

customer_reviews.title: Great for all your services in one place.
customer_reviews.text: I got this mainly to be able to stream services I use - YouTube, Hulu, Amazon Prime, Disney+, Vudu - on a single device. Roku is great for this and I have no problems streaming any of these services or others offered on Roku. It's easy to set up, easy to use and streams great. (I have it connected directly to the internet via a cable instead of wi-fi.) I don't have a 4K TV, so It's running HD (1920x1080, 60p) and produces a flawless picture. Very nice device. Voice recognition is good and works well with Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Critterbob

customer_reviews.title: HDMI Cable Not Included
customer_reviews.text: Just don't understand why Roku Ultra did not include HDMI cable. I prefer to pay little extra for it than I have to go to store to buy the cable before setting up. It's just so inconvenient and cheap for online purchase. If I knew I have to go store after waiting for couple days to have my item, I would go out to buy it in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: My 4th Roku, two of which were sticks. This upgrade is replacing a fairly new $50 Roku stick in my living room, and there is a noticeable difference in how Sling is working -- less buffering and having to reboot every couple of hours (which both Sling and DirectTV Now were doing). Since Sling and DTVNow work differently than other streaming apps (like Netflix for example), they do have more issues that become annoying. So, happy that this Ultra has minimized that. Not sure you would need this upgraded service if you have satellite TV, but not sure about that.
customer_reviews.author: Linda ScottTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great Roku experience.
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleased with my purchase. It came pretty quickly and was very easy to set up and use. The new voice command remote and the addition of the headphones were nice pluses, but the heart of the Roku experience is the device itself. It works great, the picture is clear, sharp and vibrant, the audio quality is great, and I love that it auto-detects the right picture and audio settings. Although it's a prIcy-er option that other choices, I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Curious Cyclist

customer_reviews.title: Best 4K streaming box around
customer_reviews.text: I love this box. I have the 2018 version in the living room. This 2019 version is a little faster and the remote is a little different. I will be adding this unit to the master bedroom. Navigating the menus is easy, plenty of apps and services to use. You can add a micro SD card to help with storage and buffering. I also like that you can listen with any headphones when you plug them into the remote (this drains the batteries in the remote a lot quicker and remote warms up). Always buy around Black Friday and you’ll get this beauty for $49.99
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: Consistent Blackouts
customer_reviews.text: The Roku Ultra drops both audio and video every hour or so. It only lasts a second or two, but the video feed continues so you miss 1-2 seconds of whatever you are watching. It happens with Netflix, Amazon, Disney+, and any other channel on Roku. It does not happen when playing from a DVD, XBox, Nintendo swtich, etc. Switching inputs on the TV, HDMI cables, and/or resolution do not make a difference. Note that the Roku is connected via Cat 6 cable so it's not the Wifi. Do not buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Stop Renting A Cable Box
customer_reviews.text: If you haven't considered cutting the cord with your cable company, now is the time. For a little under $100 (I paid $89), you can have a much smaller box with picture quality as good or better than your cable box. It's easy to use and easy to set up. It's also much smaller than my old cable box. I was paying $12 a month for my Verizon FiOS box, so in 9 or 10 months the savings will have paid for this unit. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Powers

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: For the top of the line streaming device in 2019 I expected much much better. I only have two complaints, but they really ruin the whole experience: The apps are laggy, and the remote buttons are soft and mushy. When I say laggy, I mean... wow. Press a button and literally not know if the remote registered it for a second or two. Really bad. I've actually switched back to my 5 year old Fire TV for some apps because performance is so bad on the Roku Ultra. I would not recommend this product unless you can get it for $40 or under. I spent $100 and am pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: RO

customer_reviews.title: unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of Roku Ultras to replace my old Ruku units. Both experience problems where the screen freezes and the remote stops working. It is necessary to remove and reinset the batteries in the remote get it working again. Also, the Roku reboots on its own at random. Could not pair one Roku with my Samsung tv, so the audio and power buttons do not work on this remote. Called Roku tech support and they were unable to resolve this issue. Firmware is up to date. The ultra is not ready for prime time.
customer_reviews.author: Marv Abraham

customer_reviews.title: Defective Remote Control
customer_reviews.text: The remote on this does not work. We've had this Roku for two weeks and we've already replace the batteries twice. The function buttons have to be pressed multiple times before it takes and the earbuds don't work when plugged into the remote, but work fine when tested on another device. I tried reaching out to Amazon, but finding a number on the website is impossible. Tried using chat and I was immediately sent to the return item page. I do not have the original box/packaging, so I cannot return the item. What I'd like is to possibly speak to a live person so that I can get a new remote maybe.
customer_reviews.author: Gigiann

customer_reviews.title: If you've ever had a Roku you probably wouldn't bother reading the reviews . . .
customer_reviews.text: I've lost track of how many Rokus we have purchased between home and gifts over the years! Always plugs right in, connects right up and knows where it is and who we are. Truly effortless! We are cord cutters and have relied on our Roku and internet TV for all of our needs and have never been disappointed! The only reason that I did not give 5 stars for Alexa integration may just be the learning curve - will come back and re-evaluate after having worked with it more.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Nothing exciting
customer_reviews.text: Brand new, this Roku device seems like it’s 10 years old. • The remote control is clunky, heavy, and the navigation buttons are very simple, but not intuitive. It looks old. 4 Quick buttons are fixed services that I don’t use. • The onscreen interface is straightforward. Customization of its appearance also offers seemingly dated appearance options. The screensaver is the best part. • Roku video service... I’ve experienced no benefit over other streaming services. Overall, disappointing. I wish I had returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen X

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE OF 4K BLACK FLASHING ALL THE TIME!
customer_reviews.text: If it only didn't flash back screen at 4k. I have another Roku that was only wifi, so I thought the black flashing was from a poor connection. The ultra is connected to a LAN, but it still flashes black at 4k. The only option is to manually set your TV to 1080p, which is an absolutely ridiculous thing to have to do. I looked online about changing settings, etc, but to no avail. I'm surprised roku is not being called on this! I spent the extra money for a nice 4k TV, but can't watch any 4k content! Totally unacceptable Roku!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Not as advertised. We tried to set it up and the product has a $50 fee to set up. We’ve had several Roku units in the past and none have had this fee.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Buy a ROKU!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down far, far better than any Amazon FireStick for streaming. Does NOT lose connection with router (as does Amazon). DOES have a remote finder feature with an audible sound through the remote when activated by a push of the button on the console. Amazon Prime can be streamed with ROKU, so why purchase an Amazon product. Plus ROKU has free movies beyond what Amazon Prime has. There is no charge for the ROKU service if you are satisfied with your own subscriptions to Hulu, HBO, Showtime, Netflix etc. Buy a ROKU!
customer_reviews.author: Coyote

customer_reviews.title: Best 4K streaming device
customer_reviews.text: I don't care about voice commands and other such nonsense, as I don't wish to open my life to the likes of Alexa and other garbage, but this does a far better job of delivering streaming content to me than my LG 4K television. Netflix, Hulu, Disney+ and all others look far better coming through on this than on my LG WebOS TV, especially fast-motion content. We've even noticed a big difference when watching AGT, where the ROKU delivers while the TV does not. Do yourself a favor, and just get this. It's far better than the TV or disk player you already have.
customer_reviews.author: SkedAddled

customer_reviews.title: Really works
customer_reviews.text: I had an older ROKU and it kept de-attaching itself from the internet (wired, not wi-fi, Spectrum/Time Warner, Orange County Ca.). In particular Youtube did not function. I was sure it was the internet provider causing the problems. In frustration I bought this, and to my surprise, the problems went away. The new Roku works really well and never drops the signal. Also, the controller turns on the TV, and controls the volume. So the old TV remote control is no longer needed. My only complaint is that it does not have a full alphabetic keyboard. But to tell the truth, the little point and click thing works well enough to get by and be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Angelito

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a Roku stick, and having the wired ethernet connection and a faster processor really makes a difference. It is noticeably faster to switch channels and I no longer have the streaming timeouts I had with the WiFi model. The remote is hefty, and I have not had the problem some users have reported by hitting the mute button by mistake. I may replace my other streaming stick with this same model. Overall I am very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Terry B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cord cutters and user friendly
customer_reviews.text: This is an upgrade from my Roku 4. So far it is performing flawlessly. It runs much cooler than the old version and the picture is excellent. We recently decided to move to streaming all of our TV content and cancelled the satellite subscription. We tried an Android box and was very disappointed. We are extremely happy with the Roku platform and feel this is an upgrade from our satellite tv service. We now have all of our favorite programming with better picture quality for less than half the cost!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must buy of you don't have a smart tv
customer_reviews.text: It worked amazing very easy to use the Roku very slick remote and very few it's nice that comes with remote headphones and it's very fast and grateful for 4k tons of apps for it very fast to setup and easy for sure if your TV doesn't have it buy it a must
customer_reviews.author: Dane Diesner

customer_reviews.title: Super Simple SetUp works like a charm right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I bought the ultra because of the reviews and thought the headphone jack on the remote is a good idea. I love how easy it is to set up and intuitive the menu is. This is meant to be my utility TV on the go....moving TV outside, in the RV, etc. The compact design makes it easily portable for those uses. I also like the added ethernet port. I've only been able to test it with solid access, will update the review after I've had a chance to move the unit around, use a mobile hotspot for WIFI, etc. Mobile app is a great feature. Content is good...the usual suspects and a few free network TV channels.
customer_reviews.author: dmeek

customer_reviews.title: Recurring Problems Interrupt Programming
customer_reviews.text: I have two Roku Ultra players. One is "rebuilt" and it works well. The other, the one that I purchase new from Amazon.com has recurring problems. Most frequent is "Error 020" which apparently references an HDCP error. The error message blocks access to programming and occurs at least once weekly. It stipulates that I disconnect the HDMI cables AND the power cords from both the Roku box and the TV. This is most annoying, especially when seen in light of the fact that the 'rebuilt' Roku Ultra has never had a problem. And, interestingly, the new, "problem" Roku Ultra is considerably closer to the router than the one with no issues. Further, Amazon's claimed phone support has been inaccessible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The easiest streaming device
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 TV sets with Roku embedded and one Roku Ultra, and I think Roku is doing the best streaming devices. I love the option to plug-in my headphones into the remote and see movies at night when all are asleep. One thing that prevented me from giving five stars is that once a day, it crashed, and the device does reset. I'm pretty sure that it's a software issue and, it will be fixed in the next version.
customer_reviews.author: David b.k

customer_reviews.title: Not As Good As My First Roku Ultra
customer_reviews.text: This thing is constantly hanging up and going blank screen. I have another one in my media room and have zero trouble with it. When watching Live TV on YouTube TV I am constantly having to go back to Home and reenter YouTube TV to change channels. Also getting the constant spinning wheel indicating loading new channel without it ever appearing on the screen. My other unit has none of these problems, nor do any of my other two Roku Streaming Sticks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and simple to use!
customer_reviews.text: I have been considering the Apple TV vs the Roku Ultra. I’m so glad I went with th e Ultra as it is over a hundred dollars cheaper and has all the services/channels you can get from the Apple TV. This is 4K UHD and there is no real reason to spend more for the Apple TV. Great device. Easy to use. Volume and power controls worked with no real setup. Picture quality is amazing and so is sound quality. Ease of use it stellar. Voice remote is amazing. Great purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Our forth Roku, to many issues
customer_reviews.text: Big Roku fan, just not this model. We have a roku in each room, for the good, Super easy to operate, easy set up, good picture quality. The bad, freezes, we even returned our first order and received a replacement. The second unit worked good for two months, now freezes, blank screen, always unplugging and resetting. way to much trouble! If it wasn't the only way to stream Spectrum I would through it away. I would look for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best wifi reception.
customer_reviews.text: I have found this model Roku has the best reception (compared to other Roku types I own) in areas where the wifi signal strenth may be lower. I find it easier to use than my Apple TV for fast forwarding. I particularly like the integrated volume controls with the ability to connect ear phones to the remote. The four dedicated streaming service buttons on the romote save a few clicks if you hvae one of those services. This Roku is extremely easy to set up and pair with the TV.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lord

customer_reviews.title: Bummer.  Is it just me?
customer_reviews.text: I've had a lot of Roku products as well as an Amazon FireTV unit. All worked well, and those in use now are prefect except for my Roku Ultra device. I purchased 2 in the last 4 months and both flamed out. The issues were mostly with audio problems that were always corrected by restarting the Roku. Another Ultra problem was video jerkiness, which was also corrected by unit restarts. Actually, I expect to see almost daily restarts with the device I just bought last week from a non-Amazon store. Note that my other Rokus and Amazon devices are just fine, my Internet is blazing fast, etc. Roku Ultras just seem to have me on their lemon list.
customer_reviews.author: EW

customer_reviews.title: Roku Requires Credit Card To Use Now
customer_reviews.text: They require a credit card just to use the device and there is no way to skip this option. I would have choose something else if i had known this before.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy.

customer_reviews.title: AN AMAZING  UNIT But......
customer_reviews.text: What an EXCELLENT unit!.. but, it does not have a web browser.... that's a big drawback..... I'm adding now after my first review. Firestick does have several browsers you can use. I.m downgrading the overall performance to a 4 stars . quality is superb, the packing where it came is the best. Installation and setting up was A1.... and, specially, the JBL very high quality headphones are great!.... You'll plug them on your remote and I was surprised how loud they play and the sound quality is perfect..... these headphones can be used, also, on your phone for music listening..... Amazing overall product. I give it a 10 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Luis Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for YouTube on a tv
customer_reviews.text: This is very powerful and high def YouTube instantly makes it worth the buy. It also has an amazing wireless controller with headphone jack that also makes it worth buying. Lots of streaming. Most want a credit card to watch more than previews. Still better than cable. Turning it off and on is the only real.pronlem. it doesn't turn off and keeps playing audio but it turns off the TV. It's weird they need to fix that and have it hibernate.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Bokeh

customer_reviews.title: Not a happy customer
customer_reviews.text: On our 2nd Roku (1st one was doa). The remote is crap. It unpairs all the time and is a pain to have to turn off my router just to pair my remote. It's almost like they made a crap remote so you have to get their app. The app is fine but if you have guests or kiddos you need a remote. Tip: The remote is WiFi direct so if you are having trouble getting the remote to connect, try turning off your WiFi router when you are trying to pair it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: WATCH OUT FOR FRAUD FROM ROKU SUPPORT NUMBER
customer_reviews.text: ROKU FRAUD - IF YOU CANNOT PAIR YOU WILL CALL THE NUMBER ON THE SCREEN AND THEY WILL TELL YOU YOU NEED TO PAY A ONE TIME PAYMENT. NOT TRUE. HANG UP AND GO BACK TO YOUR COMPUTER AND EITHER SIGN IN IF YOU HAVE AN ACCOUNT OR SET UP ACCOUNT WITH ROKU ONLINE AND ACTIVATE DEVICE THERE. YOU DO NOT NEED TO PAY ANYTHING TO ACTIVATE OR USE THE DEVICE ONCE IT IS PURCHASED. I HAVE HAD THIS HAPPEN TWICE UPON BUYING ROKU STREAMING DEVICES. IF YOU TELL THEM NO THEY WILL CONTNUE TO CALL YOU BACK AND ARGUE YOU NEED TO PAY -- YOU DO NOT NEED TO PAY!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen S. Champ

customer_reviews.title: Fast, easy to use, crystal clear, is not bothered by microwave or similar devices.
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak for the volume, since I use my receiver for that, but this device has exceeded expectations. Our previous streaming device was unreliable, slow, freaked out if someone used the microwave or similar appliance, and we ended up with crappy video and audio even on a good day. Using the same gateway and IP as before , with the Roku the sound and images are crystal clear, & other appliances do not bother it one bit. That it is extremely easy to set up, customize, and use is just a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer in TX

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device for Streaming
customer_reviews.text: With past experiences, I'm sticking with Roku as the best streaming device available. Excellent setup and configuration options, would recommend them to anyone. I did have ONE issue with this device, it seemed faulty when I got it. Turning off the TV of my Westinghouse TV and back on would cause the Roku image to have static and keep cutting out. Powercycling the Roku would restore the image until the next time I turned the TV off. I had Amazon send a replacement, have no further issues with it. First time I've had any issue with a Roku device like that, there's always bound to be some failed devices with electronics so not counting it against them.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Horrible support
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on Nov 28th, received it on December 5ish. The remote keeps losing connection every few minutes – annoying as hell. I contacted Roku regarding this. They want to replace this device. I am fine with that, but they would want me to ship the old device and wait for the new device. This is not acceptable. They can charge a temporary fee and refund it once i return it. So, I decided to return it to Amazon instead.
customer_reviews.author: S. Paplikar

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I was just using the apps pre programmed on my smart tv, but they were slowly not working anymore because the apps were outdated. The Roku is fabulous, I wish I would have bought one a long time ago. The buttons are very sensitive. Just brushing my hand against it will occasionally trigger a button. I’m still getting used to the side mute/volume buttons. Their placement seems a bit odd, but I think once my brain remembers they are there it shouldn’t be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade to the Roku 3.
customer_reviews.text: Faster than the Roku 3 and with 2 toddlers, the beepy findy button thingy has been indispensable. One complaint: Don't expect to really use the "listen using the Roku app" on your phone feature. It's slow & too choppy, and unfortunately even causes video to pause. I was hoping to be able to use that feature with my wireless earbuds, but unfortunately it is lacking. This is not a breaking point at all however, I still gave it 5 stars because the main reason we bought it was because we were always going on adventures to "find the Roku remote" with the Roku 3 (which became an excellent addition to a different room's TV).
customer_reviews.author: fedaalis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect 10
customer_reviews.text: I wish I'd bought one sooner. Great user interface, knows ur subscriptions when searching titles, great look and feel, remote control is near perfect ( move mute button from side, I hit it too much by accident), u can add any video streaming app u want (no limitations that I know of), and has introduced me to a wonder world of apps with FREE proraming like Pluto TV, Crackle, and many more. Download NBC, CBS, and ABC. Watch TV for hours on end. And I can finally download my YouTube TV app (no thanks to proprietary Samsung tv's). U can't download anything other than their crappy apps. Roku is awesome. Perfect 10.
customer_reviews.author: faben yacob

customer_reviews.title: Don't forget you need an HDMI cable to install it!!
customer_reviews.text: Required an HDMI cable that did not come with the unit. It was not mentioned at the time of the order, or I would have ordered one to come with it. As it turned, I had to wait for another 5 days to get one before I could hook up the Roku unit! Otherwise, hookup and setup went as described with no issues. Plenty of videos to refer to for assistance if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Flanders

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete Product.
customer_reviews.text: What a pos product. You send me headphones which I don’t need but not the cord to actually connect it to the TV so I can use the product. And for this I paid 80 some dollars. Every other Roku I’ve owned has come with ALL the pieces necessary to make this work. I’m sending this poc back. Maybe Roku should go into dishwasher sales. Gin knows they appear to have the right mindset for it.
customer_reviews.author: ER

customer_reviews.title: Love/hate the remote
customer_reviews.text: Great streaming box with good comparability with streaming services. Better hardware and it makes a difference compared to streaming sticks and Roku TVs. But you can’t get rid of all the ads, and the remote has dedicated buttons to channels you may not even have and they can’t be changed. On the plus side, the remote doesn’t have to point at the box to work, and can be easily programmed to to turn the TV on and volume up, which is great. I got this for my boomer parents to replace the digital cable box they were over paying for. There’s definitely a learning curve to the “simpler” remote and interface.
customer_reviews.author: Earthican

customer_reviews.title: Still the king of streaming devices
customer_reviews.text: The Roku has been the king of streamers for a while, and the newest version of the Ultra is no different. It's extremely simple to set up, navigate, and operate. It has an intuitive interface and is very fast in switching menus and apps. This little device pretty much does it all. We have two in the house (a 2018 version as well as this 2019 version) and they both perform perfectly. There's no reason to look elsewhere. At its current price (as of this writing) it's a steal and you should buy two.
customer_reviews.author: General Tso Tofu

customer_reviews.title: Best Roku Yet
customer_reviews.text: I love the power button and the tv volume controls. Great addition to Roku. I loved the last Roku for the headset option on the remote, so glad they kept this feature. I’m not a fan of the new remote style, it keeps wanting to slip out of my hand, I liked the design of the old one. But, my husband prefers this remote new style, so we cancel each other out.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Elliott

customer_reviews.title: purchased 2
customer_reviews.text: purchased 2 of these because I was annoyed at my "smart tv's" which are pretty trash over time. 1 of these Roku works flawlessly. the other had some super wonky issue with the remote where it would double press the ok button. I got it replaced through support but I will say their support is the longest wait for parts to come in. were talking weeks. pros: -the interface is easy to use -voice recognition is handy -the speed and functionality kills my ps4 and smart tv's cons: -support is terrible, they get the job done eventually but nothing compared to bigger name brands. -remotes should allow you to program your own button vs the voice repeat
customer_reviews.author: Patryk

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: We, like so many others, bought this right when Disney was rolling out Disney+ but absolutely love this thing. I'm glad we got the top of the line one too the streaming is flawless and the interface so smooth. We used to stream through our Sony BluRay and they just phased things out so fast half the things we couldn't watch. Roku has an app for everything and the remote is so easy my 2.5-year-old has already picked it up. (Funny, but not convenient for us).
customer_reviews.author: Chris Mayhew

customer_reviews.title: Remote control constantly disconnecting
customer_reviews.text: Big problems with this little device. I purchased and delayed installing without realizing that the window for service and returning had closed. The device seems fine, streams well, and acts and a great “all in one” controlling my tv’s power and volume. The Problem is that the remote control disconnects from the device constantly and you have to re-pair it. I actually thought my remote control was broken and bought a second remote with the same problem. It is definitely the device. I think I’m over Roku and will switch to Apple TV.
customer_reviews.author: OUiCandi

customer_reviews.title: This the best Roku.  Unfortunately, the price is 1/3 of a 55" TCL 4K Roku TV.
customer_reviews.text: I like the speed of response compared to the Roku3 that I replaced. i like the aquarium screen saver and the automatic training of the remote control. There is no need for two remotes. There is a remote pager button the top of the unit. The only negative that I can see so far, is its price. Compared to its less powerful siblings, you can pay $99 for the Roku, which is only $200 away from the cost of a new TCL 4K Roku 55". My decision variables included avoiding the removal a 60" 1080p LG plasma from the wall.
customer_reviews.author: DanEnzmann

customer_reviews.title: Audio Issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 recently - within 60 days one of the devices has audio issues. Strange crackling and popping periodically and about once a week the audio totally craps out and is all static. Reboot fixes. I replaced all the wiring and switched tv's; the issue followed the Roku device. Roku is exchanging the device, however I have to pay shipping and wait for them to return one which only happens once they receive the defective one back. So, decent CS I suppose but now I'm still down one TV for 1-2 weeks (first world problems). The working one is rock solid, great audio/video quality and good interface.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!  Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Roku. Cut the cable cord last month, and have been using this to stream Youtube TV, Amazon prime, Disney+ and Netflix. Also able to stream Apple TV, I just don't use Apple TV very much. Nice to plug the Roku using the ethernet for the fastest possible internet. The interface is good, home screen on the Roku let's you pick which streaming service you want to use. It's really nice to have all my services on the home screen. Loading each app is pretty quick. Voice search on the remote works fine. Easy to learn how to use. So far it's been great! Very recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Dave, Boston

customer_reviews.title: My favorite Roku so far
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful Roku. It’s the third one I’ve purchased for our home and it’s worth every penny. I have a smart TV, but it doesn’t include some of the apps we use, but the Roku offers everything we use such as HBO, Disney+, and Spectrum. We have a 4K TV, and the new Roku offers a gorgeous picture and a great way to screen for the 4K content. I love the power and volume buttons on the Roku remote, too.
customer_reviews.author: ProgJulie
